column4: Is it okay for me to run ubuntu w/ less than a gig of storage left?
how much space is USED .. ? and what filesystem are you using?
i've used about 18gb....and not sure which filesystem :(
its usually a bad idea to have less than 10-20 % free space because fragmentation increases nonlinearly as free space decreases
i'm not planning on using anymore space....i just cleaned up....and no some apps are runing oddly :(
what is the command to check my hd space again?
yeah you dont have much free do you ;)
it's actually a nice computer...just a tiny hd..
just don't let /tmp or /var/log fill up :-0
may that be why things were getting messed up?
but would the damage be permanent?
cant i just reinstall...i tried...but same error :(
you might need to purge & reinstall
i'm really contemplating removing sauerbraten for space..
never heard of it .. i'm installing it ;)
is it wise to truecrypt your hard drive?........i have nothing to hid but....it sounds cool.. ..
not unless you need to ... a surprising number of people forget their passwords ...
okay....uh....its the newest release i guess.
okay the package that is giving me trouble is gnome-rdp...
how do i purge and reinstall that?
aptitude purge gnome-rdp; aptitude install gnome-rdp
will this give me a menu item?
the gnome add/remove is just a gtk front end for aptitude / synaptic / apt / dpkg
it asked you for your password ?
uh how much room does truecrypt take up?
and do i have that room :)
i won't but, i like to try new things on this box :)
its not going to give you anything
that is my error with sudo
thats an aptitude error not a sudo error ..
i couldnt remember the name of your package
sorry easily excited at this early hour :)
also try running aptitude with just: sudo aptitude
you see some shit on the screen or what?
error with aptitude or the package ?
just checking if sudo was working ;) thats the system shadow password file
so i can't send you this...
application error?...i'm really sorry...it's sooo early
error during connection to the database
most apps use "dotfiles" in your home dir to store prefs and data
